edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.backend.www
Class WWWSession

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.backend.www.WWWSession
All Implemented Interfaces:
WWWConstants
public class WWWSession
extends java.lang.Object
implements WWWConstants

Represents the connection between the WWWBackEndLSP and some web-based search engine. One session is created for each query. Once the session is created, the WWWQueryProcessor continues to call the getDocs() method, retrieving documents until either a null is returned, or the isEmpty() method returns true.

During each invocation of getDocs(), the following happens:

  • In one thread, the CGI request is invoked and results are sent to HTML Tidy, a free tool from W3C that converts the HTML into well-formed XML. The output of this thread is piped to a second thread.
  • In the second thread, the Apache Xalan XSL processor uses the www_results.xsl stylesheet to transform the incoming XML into starts_intermediate form. The result should look something like this: 
          <starts:intermediate>
          <starts:sqrdocument>
              <starts:rawscore>0.9</starts:rawscore>
              <starts:doc-term>
                <starts:field name="title">
                <starts:value>cardiovascular<starts:value>
              </starts:doc-term>
              <starts:doc-term> . . .
          </starts:sqrdocument>
          <starts:sqrdocument> . . .
          <starts:script>
          <starts:url method='GET | POST'>
              http://www.google.com
          </starts:url>
          <starts:variable>
              <starts:name>search<starts:name>
              <starts:value>cardiovascular<starts:value>
          </starts:variable>
          <starts:variable> . . . . .
          </starts:script>
      </starts:intermediate>
    Each <starts:sqrdocument> represents one result extracted from the page. The <starts:script> represents a translation of a "more" button at the bottom of the HTML results page, and is present only if there was such a button there.
  • The starts_intermediate output is sent as a stream of SAX events, to an instance of STARTSIntermediateHandler, which will extract the results as LSPDocs and, if the "more" button was present, will extract a new invocation coded as an HTTPRequest.
  • getDocs() returns the LSPDocs
  • If there was no "more" button, or the maximum number of documents required for the query is exceeded, or an Exception happened somewhere, then isEmpty() will return true at its next invocation.
  • Otherwise, calling getDocs() again automatically invokes the new HTTPRequest that was retrieved during translation.
  • This class now handles multi-level results, i.e., we can simulate multiple clicks on first level page to retrieve results from second or deeperlevel pages
This class does not deal with errors on the server, or timeouts, etc. A future version should.

For more information about the starts_intermediate format, see the starts_intermediate.dtd.

Constructor Detail

WWWSession

public WWWSession(java.lang.String backEndLSPName,
                  HTTPRequest request,
                  int maxDocs,
                  LSPField[] answerFields)
           throws BackEndException,
                  org.xml.sax.SAXException
Start a session with a web search engine.
Parameters:
backEndLSPName - the name of the BackEndLSP using this session (needed for locating the www_results.xsl file
request - the HTTPRequest representing the original CGI-BIN invocation onto the search engine
maxDocs - the maximum number of documents to retrieve in the course of the session
answerFields - the fields that ought to appear in the results of the session.
Method Detail

getDocs

public LSPDoc[] getDocs()
                 throws BackEndException
Makes a CGI invocation onto a web search engine, blocks, and then returns results extracted from the HTML returned by the web site. Will automatically return null if the isEmpty() method is returning true. If isEmpty() is not true, this method can be called repeatedly - it means there is a "more" button at the bottom of the results HTML page, and the maximum document limit has not yet been exceeded.
Returns:
documents extracted from the HTML results page, or null if there are no results.

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Checks to see whether more results can be obtained in this session by another call to getDocs().
Returns:
true if either the maximum number of desired documents is exceeded, or there is no "more" button at the bottom of the last retrieved HTML page, or there has been an Exception; false otherwise

getNumAvailable

public int getNumAvailable()
